segment.source: Application Virtualization Glossary
segment.target: Application Virtualization Glossary

segment.source: Application Virtualization Glossary
segment.target: Application Virtualization Glossary

segment.source: Application Virtualization Glossary
segment.target: Application Virtualization Glossary

segment.source: Term
segment.target: Term

segment.source: Definition
segment.target: Definition

segment.source: active upgrade
segment.target: active upgrade

segment.source: An upgrade that enables a new version of an application to be added to an App-V Management Server or Streaming Server without affecting users currently running the application.
segment.target: An upgrade that enables a new version of an application to be added to an App-V Management Server or Streaming Server without affecting users currently running the application.

segment.source: Application Source Root
segment.target: Application Source Root

segment.source: Reference to a registry key that allows an override of the OSD CODEBASE for the HREF element (for example, the source location).
segment.target: Reference to a registry key that allows an override of the OSD CODEBASE for the HREF element (for example, the source location).

segment.source: This registry value enables an administrator or ESD system to ensure application loading is performed according to a planned topology management scheme.
segment.target: This registry value enables an administrator or ESD system to ensure application loading is performed according to a planned topology management scheme.

segment.source: Application Virtualization drive
segment.target: Application Virtualization drive

segment.source: The default virtual application client drive (Q:) from which sequenced applications are run.
segment.target: The default virtual application client drive (Q:) from which sequenced applications are run.

segment.source: Application Virtualization reporting
segment.target: Application Virtualization reporting

segment.source: Virtual application information gathered for data analysis.
segment.target: Virtual application information gathered for data analysis.

segment.source: Data is collected for assembly of custom views and interpretation.
segment.target: Data is collected for assembly of custom views and interpretation.

segment.source: AutoLoad configuration parameter
segment.target: AutoLoad configuration parameter

segment.source: A client runtime policy configuration parameter that enables the secondary feature block of a virtualized application to be streamed to the client automatically in the background.
segment.target: A client runtime policy configuration parameter that enables the secondary feature block of a virtualized application to be streamed to the client automatically in the background.

segment.source: branch a package
segment.target: branch a package

segment.source: To upgrade an existing sequenced application package and run it side-by-side with the original sequenced application package.
segment.target: To upgrade an existing sequenced application package and run it side-by-side with the original sequenced application package.

segment.source: Dynamic Suite Composition
segment.target: Dynamic Suite Composition

segment.source: An Application Virtualization feature that enables a virtual application package to allow dependent plug-ins or middleware packages to use the virtual environment.
segment.target: An Application Virtualization feature that enables a virtual application package to allow dependent plug-ins or middleware packages to use the virtual environment.

segment.source: This feature enables plug-ins and middleware packages to use the primary package's registry settings, and the packages behave and interact with one another in the same way as if they were installed locally on a comuter.
segment.target: This feature enables plug-ins and middleware packages to use the primary package's registry settings, and the packages behave and interact with one another in the same way as if they were installed locally on a comuter.

segment.source: ICO file
segment.target: ICO file

segment.source: The file for the icon on the client's desktop used to launch a sequenced application.
segment.target: The file for the icon on the client's desktop used to launch a sequenced application.

segment.source: Icon Source Root
segment.target: Icon Source Root

segment.source: Reference to a registry key that allows specification of a source location for icon retrieval for a sequenced application package during publication.
segment.target: Reference to a registry key that allows specification of a source location for icon retrieval for a sequenced application package during publication.

segment.source: Icon Source Roots support UNC formats only (not URLs).
segment.target: Icon Source Roots support UNC formats only (not URLs).

segment.source: Installation directory
segment.target: Installation directory

segment.source: The directory where the installer for the application virtualization sequencer places its files.
segment.target: The directory where the installer for the application virtualization sequencer places its files.

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization Desktop Client
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization Desktop Client

segment.source: An application that resides on a Windows-based computer desktop and which communicates and authenticates with the Microsoft System Center Virtual Application Server to receive the application code and allow a sequenced application to be run locally.
segment.target: An application that resides on a Windows-based computer desktop and which communicates and authenticates with the Microsoft System Center Virtual Application Server to receive the application code and allow a sequenced application to be run locally.

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization for Terminal Services
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization for Terminal Services

segment.source: The Application Virtualization feature, including both client and server components, running in a Terminal Services environment.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization feature, including both client and server components, running in a Terminal Services environment.

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management Console
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management Console

segment.source: Centralized snap-in to the Microsoft Management Console, which you use to administer the Application Virtualization Management System.
segment.target: Centralized snap-in to the Microsoft Management Console, which you use to administer the Application Virtualization Management System.

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management System
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management System

segment.source: A specific deployment of the Application Virtualization platform that includes all of the components that are managed by a single data store.
segment.target: A specific deployment of the Application Virtualization platform that includes all of the components that are managed by a single data store.

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management Web Service
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management Web Service

segment.source: A service that acts as an intermediary between the Application Virtualization Management Console and the data store.
segment.target: A service that acts as an intermediary between the Application Virtualization Management Console and the data store.

segment.source: First it authenticates its users, and then it allows authorized administrators to manipulate data in the data store.
segment.target: First it authenticates its users, and then it allows authorized administrators to manipulate data in the data store.

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization platform
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization platform

segment.source: Name for the Microsoft products that are used to create, store, distribute, and run virtualized applications.
segment.target: Name for the Microsoft products that are used to create, store, distribute, and run virtualized applications.

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization Sequencer
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization Sequencer

segment.source: Application that monitors and records the installation and setup process for applications so that an application can be sequenced and run in the virtual environment.
segment.target: Application that monitors and records the installation and setup process for applications so that an application can be sequenced and run in the virtual environment.

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization Terminal Services Client
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization Terminal Services Client

segment.source: An application that resides on a Terminal Server and which communicates and authenticates with the Microsoft Virtual Application Server to receive the application code and allow a sequenced application to be run locally.
segment.target: An application that resides on a Terminal Server and which communicates and authenticates with the Microsoft Virtual Application Server to receive the application code and allow a sequenced application to be run locally.

segment.source: Microsoft System Center Application Virtualization Management Server
segment.target: Microsoft System Center Application Virtualization Management Server

segment.source: One of two Application Virtualization server types from which a sequenced application package can be streamed.
segment.target: One of two Application Virtualization server types from which a sequenced application package can be streamed.

segment.source: In addition to streaming virtual application packages, the Application Virtualization Management Server offers other services such as publishing, management, reporting, and so on.
segment.target: In addition to streaming virtual application packages, the Application Virtualization Management Server offers other services such as publishing, management, reporting, and so on.

segment.source: Microsoft System Center Application Virtualization Streaming Server
segment.target: Microsoft System Center Application Virtualization Streaming Server

segment.source: One of two Application Virtualization server types from which a sequenced application package can be streamed.
segment.target: One of two Application Virtualization server types from which a sequenced application package can be streamed.

segment.source: The Streaming Server streams applications to the client computers only and does not offer other services such as publishing, management, reporting, and so on.
segment.target: The Streaming Server streams applications to the client computers only and does not offer other services such as publishing, management, reporting, and so on.

segment.source: Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file
segment.target: Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file

segment.source: An XML-based file that instructs the client on how to retrieve the sequenced application from the Application Virtualization Management/Streaming Server and how to run the sequenced application in its virtual environment.
segment.target: An XML-based file that instructs the client on how to retrieve the sequenced application from the Application Virtualization Management/Streaming Server and how to run the sequenced application in its virtual environment.

segment.source: OSD Source Root
segment.target: OSD Source Root

segment.source: Reference to a registry key that allows specification of a source location for OSD file retrieval for an application package during publication.
segment.target: Reference to a registry key that allows specification of a source location for OSD file retrieval for an application package during publication.

segment.source: OSD Source Roots support UNC formats only (not URLs).
segment.target: OSD Source Roots support UNC formats only (not URLs).

segment.source: package root directory
segment.target: package root directory

segment.source: The directory on the sequencing computer on which files for the sequenced application package are installed.
segment.target: The directory on the sequencing computer on which files for the sequenced application package are installed.

segment.source: This directory also exists virtually on the computer to which a sequenced application will be streamed.
segment.target: This directory also exists virtually on the computer to which a sequenced application will be streamed.

segment.source: primary feature block
segment.target: primary feature block

segment.source: The minimum content in an application package that is necessary for an application to run.
segment.target: The minimum content in an application package that is necessary for an application to run.

segment.source: The content in the primary feature block is identified during the application phase of sequencing and typically consists of the content for the most used application features.
segment.target: The content in the primary feature block is identified during the application phase of sequencing and typically consists of the content for the most used application features.

segment.source: secondary feature block
segment.target: secondary feature block

segment.source: The remainder of the application package that is not contained in the primary feature block.
segment.target: The remainder of the application package that is not contained in the primary feature block.

segment.source: This content is streamed to the client on demand as application features are used.
segment.target: This content is streamed to the client on demand as application features are used.

segment.source: sequenced application
segment.target: sequenced application

segment.source: An application that has been monitored by the Sequencer, broken up into primary and secondary feature blocks, streamed to a computer running the Microsoft Application Virtualization Terminal Services Client or the Microsoft Application Virtualization Desktop Client, and can run inside of its own virtual environment.
segment.target: An application that has been monitored by the Sequencer, broken up into primary and secondary feature blocks, streamed to a computer running the Microsoft Application Virtualization Terminal Services Client or the Microsoft Application Virtualization Desktop Client, and can run inside of its own virtual environment.

segment.source: sequenced application package
segment.target: sequenced application package

segment.source: The files that comprise a virtual application and allow a virtual application to run.
segment.target: The files that comprise a virtual application and allow a virtual application to run.

segment.source: These files are created after sequencing and specifically include .osd, .sft, .sprj, and .ico files.
segment.target: These files are created after sequencing and specifically include .osd, .sft, .sprj, and .ico files.

segment.source: sequencing
segment.target: sequencing

segment.source: The process of creating an application package by using the Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: The process of creating an application package by using the Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: In this process, an application is monitored, its shortcuts are configured, and a sequenced application package is created containing the .osd, .sft, .sprj, and .ico files.
segment.target: In this process, an application is monitored, its shortcuts are configured, and a sequenced application package is created containing the .osd, .sft, .sprj, and .ico files.

segment.source: sequencing computer
segment.target: sequencing computer

segment.source: The computer used to perform sequencing and create a sequenced application package.
segment.target: The computer used to perform sequencing and create a sequenced application package.

segment.source: Sequencing Wizard
segment.target: Sequencing Wizard

segment.source: Step-by-step wizard that walks the user through sequencing an application, including package configuration, installing the application or applications to be sequenced, and sequencing the application package for streaming.
segment.target: Step-by-step wizard that walks the user through sequencing an application, including package configuration, installing the application or applications to be sequenced, and sequencing the application package for streaming.

segment.source: SFT
segment.target: SFT

segment.source: A file that contains one or more sequenced applications that the Sequencer has packaged into streaming blocks, as well as the associated delivery information.
segment.target: A file that contains one or more sequenced applications that the Sequencer has packaged into streaming blocks, as well as the associated delivery information.

segment.source: The SFT file is stored on each server that must stream the packaged applications to a client.
segment.target: The SFT file is stored on each server that must stream the packaged applications to a client.

segment.source: SFTMIME
segment.target: SFTMIME

segment.source: A command-line interface for setting up and managing applications, file type associations, and desktop configuration servers managed by Application Virtualization Desktop and Terminal Services Clients.
segment.target: A command-line interface for setting up and managing applications, file type associations, and desktop configuration servers managed by Application Virtualization Desktop and Terminal Services Clients.

segment.source: SPRJ file
segment.target: SPRJ file

segment.source: An XML-based Sequencer Project file, in which the Sequencer stores its Exclusion Items and Parse Items information.
segment.target: An XML-based Sequencer Project file, in which the Sequencer stores its Exclusion Items and Parse Items information.

segment.source: The SPRJ file is used heavily in the creation of application records as well as during an upgrade to a package.
segment.target: The SPRJ file is used heavily in the creation of application records as well as during an upgrade to a package.

segment.source: virtual application
segment.target: virtual application

segment.source: An application packaged by the Sequencer to run in a self-contained, virtual environment.
segment.target: An application packaged by the Sequencer to run in a self-contained, virtual environment.

segment.source: The virtual environment contains the information necessary to run the application on the client without installing the application locally.
segment.target: The virtual environment contains the information necessary to run the application on the client without installing the application locally.

segment.source: Virtual COM
segment.target: Virtual COM

segment.source: The subsystem that manages COM objects created by application processes running in a virtual environment and prevents conflict with the same objects created outside the virtual environment.
segment.target: The subsystem that manages COM objects created by application processes running in a virtual environment and prevents conflict with the same objects created outside the virtual environment.

segment.source: virtual directory
segment.target: virtual directory

segment.source: An opaque directory where only files and subdirectories defined in the application package or created through interaction with an application in a virtual environment are visible.
segment.target: An opaque directory where only files and subdirectories defined in the application package or created through interaction with an application in a virtual environment are visible.

segment.source: Any files in an identically named local directory are not visible to the application.
segment.target: Any files in an identically named local directory are not visible to the application.

segment.source: virtual environment
segment.target: virtual environment

segment.source: A runtime container that defines the resources available to application processes launched from a sequenced application package.
segment.target: A runtime container that defines the resources available to application processes launched from a sequenced application package.

segment.source: virtual file
segment.target: virtual file

segment.source: A file name within the virtual environment that is mapped to an alternate target location.
segment.target: A file name within the virtual environment that is mapped to an alternate target location.

segment.source: A virtual file appears alongside other files in the containing directory, regardless of whether that directory is virtual or local.
segment.target: A virtual file appears alongside other files in the containing directory, regardless of whether that directory is virtual or local.

segment.source: virtual file system
segment.target: virtual file system

segment.source: The subsystem that intercepts and redirects file system requests from application processes running in a virtual environment.
segment.target: The subsystem that intercepts and redirects file system requests from application processes running in a virtual environment.

segment.source: These requests are processed based on the virtual files and directories defined in the application package and created or modified through interaction with a virtual application.
segment.target: These requests are processed based on the virtual files and directories defined in the application package and created or modified through interaction with a virtual application.

segment.source: virtual registry
segment.target: virtual registry

segment.source: The subsystem that intercepts and redirects registry requests for keys and values from application processes running in a virtual environment.
segment.target: The subsystem that intercepts and redirects registry requests for keys and values from application processes running in a virtual environment.

segment.source: The redirection is based on the registry information defined in the application package and created or modified through interaction with a virtual application.
segment.target: The redirection is based on the registry information defined in the application package and created or modified through interaction with a virtual application.

segment.source: virtual services
segment.target: virtual services

segment.source: The subsystem that acts as the Service Control Manager (SCM) for services running in a virtual environment.
segment.target: The subsystem that acts as the Service Control Manager (SCM) for services running in a virtual environment.
